00037 /*
00038  * rpv130_init
00039  *
00040  * Called at the beginning of the run 
00041  */
00042 
00043 INT rpv130_init()
00044 {
00045         printf("VME crate init...\n");
00046         mvme_open(&myvme,0);
00047   return SUCCESS;
00048 }
00049 
00050 /*
00051  * rpv130_start_block
00052  *
00053  */
00054 INT rpv130_start_block()
00055 {
00056         rpv130_Pulse(myvme, RPV130_BASE, 2);
00057         rpv130_ClearBusy3(myvme, RPV130_BASE);
00058         clock_gettime(CLOCK_REALTIME,&timer_start);
00059   return SUCCESS;
00060 }
00061 
00062 /*
00063  * rpv130_poll_live()
00064  *
00065  * Called periodically while a block is active; performs active readout.
00066  *
00067  * Returns:
00068  * - ordinarily 0,
00069  * - a request for a "soft stop" end-of-block, or
00070  * - an error code
00071  */
00072 
00073 INT rpv130_poll_live()
00074 {
00075         struct timespec timer_now;
00076         clock_gettime(CLOCK_REALTIME, &timer_now);  
00077         unsigned int time_elapse =(timer_now.tv_sec - timer_start.tv_sec)*1000000000 +
00078                 (timer_now.tv_nsec - timer_start.tv_nsec);
00079         printf("time elapse: %ld\n", time_elapse);
00080 
00081         if (rpv130_IsBusy3(myvme, RPV130_BASE))
00082                 return FE_END_BLOCK;
00083 
00084         //if (time_elapse > 2*1000*1000)
00085         //{
00086                 //printf("end of block\n");
00087                 //return FE_END_BLOCK;
00088         //}
00089   return SUCCESS;
00090 }
